summary: The Battling Infections Transmitted by Ticks and Exposure Act (BITE Act) proposes a comprehensive national vector-borne disease prevention system. This system, overseen by the Secretary of Health and Human Services, will include a professional vector identification service, an AI-enhanced early warning system, insurance claims and syndromic surveillance, public education campaigns, and national strategic alignment targeting a reduction in Lyme disease cases and improvements in military readiness. The bill aims to combat diseases spread by ticks, mosquitoes, and fleas.
